abstracts.abstract:
Existing law, the Local Agency Public Construction Act, governs public works contracts awarded by counties and requires the work of construction or repair of specified public buildings to be done by contract, if the estimated cost exceeds $4,000, as prescribed. Existing law, in counties containing a population of 500,000 or over, exempts that work from the above-described requirement if the estimated cost of the work is less than $6,500.

This bill would make nonsubstantive changes to these provisions and would delete an obsolete reference.

actions.description: Introduced. Read first time. To Com. on RLS. for assignment. To print.
From printer. May be acted upon on or after March 15.

extras.impact_clause: An act to amend Section 20122 of the Public Contract Code, relating to public contracts.
